alert.note: Alert for Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 8:46PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Cherry County through 930 PM CDT... At 845 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Lacreek Wildlife Refuge, or 16 miles southeast of Martin. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eli. This includes Highway 20 between mile markers 148 and 155. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
